references.reason: This paper introduces C5, a cross-camera color constancy method, which is heavily relied upon in CCMNet as a baseline and comparison point, making it a crucial reference.
As the original paper introducing the Convolutional Color Constancy (CCC) framework, CCMNet's underlying architecture and methodology is based on the CCC framework.

references.paper_title: Illuminant estimation for color constancy: Why spatial-domain methods work and the role of the color distribution
references.reason: This paper provides foundational knowledge on illuminant estimation and color constancy, which are essential concepts CCMNet is built upon.

references.paper_title: Improving color reproduction accuracy on cameras
references.reason: Karaimer's work provides relevant knowledge about color reproduction on cameras which has implication in understanding the purpose and methods of the presented paper.

references.paper_title: Computational color constancy: Survey and experiments
references.reason: Gijsenij's survey provides a comprehensive overview of computational color constancy methods, establishing the context and importance of addressing color casts in images, it is an essential reference.
